snippet: The junior-market animal and art auctions at the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo are some of the biggest scholarship fund-raisers in Texas.
abstract: Junior-market animal and art auctions at the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo are some of the biggest college scholarship fund-raisers in Texas, with sales totaling $9.2 million in 2012; money is split between paying the college tuition of the high school students who raised the animals and the livestock show's educational fund, which finances scholarships, research grants, graduate assistantships and other programs.
lead_paragraph: The junior-market animal and art auctions at the Houston Livestock Show and Rodeo are some of the biggest scholarship fund-raisers in Texas.

headline.seo: Houston Livestock Show Auctions Pay for College Scholarships
headline.main: $178,000 Is a Lot for a Pig, but This Pig Is Paying for College
headline.print_headline: $178,000 Is a Lot for a Pig, But This Pig Is Paying for College
